page.title: 06THE 'UNITED FREE GARDENERS'
page.content: A{Lodge of the United Free Gardeners was established in Aldbrough in 1847. It went under the title of {'The {Blooming Rose of Stanwick'} and its secretary was one {Thomas Gent Esq., who lived at the {Stanwick Arms} and whose occupation was given as victualler and farmer. The membership in 1890 was 100. These are the only known facts about the organisation that it has so far proved possible to establish. What its activities or aims were we do not know, nor is there any record its being disbanded or replaced by any other local horticultural or gardening society.
